passages.text: Consumer | Global Beverages
In Line | Target Price/Base Case: \(\) 3\$ Company Update

Brown- Forman reported a better- than- feared F1Q26 (ended 7/31) and reiterated its guidance. In the context of weak NABCA and scanner data, expectations had moved lower ahead of the print, with the Street modeling an organic net sales decline of \(- 3.8\%\) . BF reported organic net sales of \(+1\%\) ; However, this was aided by \(4\%\) from distributor inventory levels, with a \(6\%\) benefit in the U.S. and \(10\%\) in Emerging Markets. From a geographic perspective, net sales growth in Emerging Markets and the Travel Retail channel was more than offset by declines in the United States and Developed International markets - see more detail below. Sales upside was accompanied by GM % of \(59.8\%\) vs. \(59.3\%\) street, with 40 bps of YoY expansion driven by the positive effect of the divestitures, partially offset by higher costs, unfavorable price/mix, and the negative effect of foreign exchange. EPS of \(\) 0.36\(was below Street's\) \ \(0.38\) ; However, underperformance was driven by a \(\) 0.02\(headwind from restructuring charges and\) \ \(0.03\) from nonoperating postretirement expense. Overall, we believe reiterated guidance and 1Q sales upside, albeit aided by timing, is likely to be enough to drive shares higher given the low bar heading into the results.

U.S. \(- 2\%\) vs. \(- 4\%\) comp and \(- 5\%\) in F4Q as net sales improved sequentially but remained weak. Net sales declines driven by the absence of the Sonoma- Cutter prior- year TSA, lower volumes of Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey and Herradura, and the end of Korbel relationship, partially offset by strong initial shipments for the upcoming launch of Jack Daniel's Tennessee Blackberry and in preparation for the August \(1^{\mathrm{st}}\) , 2025, distributor transitions in the United States. Notably, shipments drove a \(6\%\) tailwind to F1Q sales

Developed International \(- 9\%\) vs. \(- 6\%\) comp and \(- 9\%\) in F4Q. Net sales declines due to soft consumer demand impacted by macroeconomic and geopolitical uncertainty. The decline was led by lower volumes of JDTW in Germany and the United Kingdom, along with the absence of American- made alcohol from retail shelves in most of the Canadian provinces, partially offset by the positive effect of foreign exchange and the benefit from the transition to owned distribution in Italy. Inventories had a \(- 1\%\) impact on F1Q sales

Emerging Markets \(+25\%\) vs. \(- 5\%\) comp and \(+12\%\) in F4Q. Results driven by higher volumes across the Jack Daniel's family of brands, which were led by Brazil and Turkey and partially benefited from an increase in distributor inventories as well as DD% growth of New Mix, partially offset by the negative effect of foreign exchange. Notably, inventories benefitted F1Q results by \(+10\%\) travel Retail \(+7\%\) vs. \(- 8\%\) comp and \(- 14\%\) in F4Q driven by higher volumes of JDTW and Gin Mare, partially due to the timing of shipments, as well as the positive effect of foreign exchange.

Trends across Whiskey remain pressured. Tequila improves off easy comp. Jack Daniel's Family \(+0\%\) vs. \(- 4\%\) comp, with Tennessee Whiskey \(- 4\%\) vs. \(- 6\%\) comp. Woodford Reserve \(- 1\%\) vs. \(+3\%\) comp, with Diplomatico \(+6\%\) vs. \(+134\%\) comp and Gin Mare \(+36\%\) vs. \(- 10\%\) comp. Tequila \(+1\%\) over F1Q26 vs. an easy comp of \(- 23\%\) and sequentially improved vs. \(- 9\%\) in F4Q25. El Jimador \(+16\%\) vs. easy \(- 26\%\) comp and Herradura \(- 15\%\) vs. \(- 14\%\) comp. RTDs improved to \(+9\%\) vs. \(+2\%\) in F4Q off a \(- 4\%\) comp
**Conference call:** 10:00 AM EST; a live audio broadcast of the conference call, and the accompanying presentation slides, will be available via Brown-Forman's website, brown-forman.com

Source: Company reports, Evercore ISI estimates, FactSet consensus
Target is based upon \(\sim 18x\) our C2026 EPS estimate

Downside risks include tariffs, continued supply chain challenges, commodity and logistics costs, erosion in pricing power for Jack Daniel's, consumer tastes shifting away from brown spirits, and RTD growth possibly impacting brown spirits. Upside risks include better than expected U.S. top line momentum, stronger than expected U.S. and global growth for Jack Daniel's #7 as well as from its RTD Jack & Coke launch, and greater than expected growth in emerging markets, including China and India.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Time of dissemination: August 28 2025 8:58 AM ET

Evercore IS's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
